com.startspring.springbootangularjs.controller

Class MainRESTController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.startspring.springbootangularjs.controller.MainRESTController

  • @RestController
public class MainRESTController
extends java.lang.Object
    Specialized version of the controller. It includes the @Controller annotation

    • Method Detail

      • getEmployees

        @RequestMapping(value="/employees",
                method=GET,
                produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @ResponseBody
public java.util.List<Employee> getEmployees()
        Using the @RequestMapping annotation we indicate where to map it and what request it should catch a GET. Use the @ResponseBody annotation to return the object as the body of the HTTP response
        Returns:
        returns the entire list of employees

      • getEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee/{empId}",
                method=GET,
                produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @ResponseBody
public Employee getEmployee(@PathVariable(value="empId")
                                                                                                                                                                                       java.lang.Long empId)
        Using the @RequestMapping annotation we indicate where to map it and what request it should catch a GET.
        Parameters:
        empId - - employee id
        Returns:
        returns the view obtained by employee id

      • addEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee",
                method=POST,
                produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @ResponseBody
public Employee addEmployee(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                EmployeeForm empForm)
        Using the @RequestMapping annotation we indicate where to map it and what request it should catch a POST.
        Parameters:
        empForm - - employee data form
        Returns:
        returns the added employee data

      • updateEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee",
                method=PUT,
                produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @ResponseBody
public Employee updateEmployee(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                  EmployeeForm empForm)
        Using the @RequestMapping annotation we indicate where to map it and what request it should catch a PUT.
        Parameters:
        empForm - -employee data form
        Returns:
        returns updated employee data

      • deleteEmployee

        @RequestMapping(value="/employee/{empId}",
                method=DELETE,
                produces={"application/json","application/xml"})
 @ResponseBody
public void deleteEmployee(@PathVariable(value="empId")

        Using the @RequestMapping annotation we indicate where to map it and what request it should catch a DELETE.
